instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115-B no power
threads.message:
820-3115-B with no power no green light. 

Corrosion around U700, replaced U700 now it was green light but no fan spin/

PPBUS_G3H is 3.4v, resistance to ground on diode mode is 0.400

threads.title: 820-3115-B no power
threads.message:
You meant U7000, I suppose.
Post the exact PPBUS_G3H voltage now?

threads.title: 820-3115-B no power
threads.message:
Yes, U7000.

PPBUS_G3H is 3.485v

threads.title: 820-3115-B no power
threads.message:
"2:          0.0v (ground)"
Diode mode to ground?

Post voltage on both pins of D7005.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no power
threads.message:
So today the board didnt show green light.

PP3V42_G3H is 0v. There is no voltage comming in F6905, also theres no short to ground on F6905.

Replaced F6905 and replaced the charging port cable, still no voltage on F6905 (it has continuity).

threads.title: 820-3115-B no power
threads.message: Also tried another charger, still nothing.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no power
threads.message:
Try fake charger, or lab PSU.
You may need to change Q7080/85.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no power
threads.message:
Dont have any at hand right now.

Replaced both Q708/85 and still no voltage on F6905

threads.title: 820-3115-B no power
threads.message:
Post diode mode to ground on both sides of D7005.
Also check R/C7011.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no power
threads.message:
D7005 diode mode:

Pin 3: 0.569

Pins 1 and 2: 0.0


R7011is 9.3k and C7011 looks ok .

threads.title: 820-3115-B no power
threads.message:
"Pins 1 and 2: 0.0"
Do you mean shorted to ground?
If yes, remove C6905 and test again.
Also try another DCIN board.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no power
threads.message:
After replacing C6905 we have green light. 

Now  PPBUS_G3H is 3.4mv and short to ground on diode mode. C7000 is getting hot and the area around is getting warm so i dont know if one of the caps is shorted.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no power
threads.message: Replaced C7000 again, same thing.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no power
threads.message:
Post exact ohm resistance to ground at PPBUS_G3H.
Then compare it with all big coils (to ground).

threads.title: 820-3115-B no power
threads.message: Remove F7040 and check where the short remains.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no power
threads.message: Removed F7040 and short was gone.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no power
threads.message:
Really???
Which pad of F7040 remains the short to ground???

threads.title: 820-3115-B no power
threads.message: Yes, pad 1 remains shorted after removal.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no power
threads.message: Remove Q7035 and check again.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no power
threads.message:
Removed Q7035. Short is gone again. 

Pin 4 is shorted.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no power
threads.message:
So you have short to ground at pin 21/U7000?
Then change Q7035 and U7000.
I also recommend to change Q7030 at same time.
Be sure R/C7025 are both good.

Do not resolder F7040, until get correct voltage at C7040.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no power
threads.message:
Pin 21 of U7000 had a bad solder joint, after resolder now we got 0.407 to ground on diode mode.

I replaced Q7030/35 and R/C7025 anyways, also replaced C7045 necause it was looking a bit corroded. 

Now i got 0.407 and 0.453 to ground on diode mode on pins 2 and 1 of F7040 (not resoldered yet). 

L7030 is also 0.453 diode mode to ground. 

However, voltage on C7040 is pulsing between 0.5v and 1.5v

threads.title: 820-3115-B no power
threads.message: Sorry, I forgot to type pin 1 above...

threads.title: 820-3115-B no power
threads.message: Pin 1:  4.1 mV

threads.title: 820-3115-B no power
threads.message: Change Q7085...

threads.title: 820-3115-B no power
threads.message: Ok now i get pulse between 3 and 4v on  C7040

threads.title: 820-3115-B no power
threads.message: Post R7020 voltage.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no power
threads.message: 16.83v on both sides

threads.title: 820-3115-B no power
threads.message: Post exact resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no power
threads.message:
Line btween pin 18 and C7050 was blown, soldered a jumper cable. 

Now:

pins 17/18  3.3 ohms

Pins 27/28 20.5 ohms

threads.title: 820-3115-B no power
threads.message: C7040 voltage now?

threads.title: 820-3115-B no power
threads.message: No change on C7040 votalge, still pulsing between 3.8 and 4

threads.title: 820-3115-B no power
threads.message:
Check all solders/traces for U7000 and surrounding components.
Be sure R7012 is good.
Don't forget the R/C networks connected to pins 5, 7, 8.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no power
threads.message: theres continuity on all pins of U7000. R7012 is 1 kohm

threads.title: 820-3115-B no power
threads.message:
Get donor board and replace all components in R/C networks from pins 5, 7, 8.
I suppose you cannot properly test the caps...
